alert.note: Alert for Johnson (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 26 at 8:32PM MDT until June 26 at 8:45PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM MDT FOR EAST CENTRAL JOHNSON COUNTY... At 832 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 12 miles northeast of Fort Reno Historical Site, which is also 32 miles northeast of Kaycee, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. This severe thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of east central Johnson County. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
